nodes.name: Sticky Note

parameters.content:
#### Purpose

Compares tracks using `Combine` operation to output **non-matching** Discover Weekly tracks to ensure that duplicates are not appended to the Archive playlist

nodes.notes: This stickyNote node performs automated tasks as part of the workflow.

nodes.name: Check if tracks to add is NOT empty
nodes.notes: This if node performs automated tasks as part of the workflow.

nodes.name: Add tracks to Archive playlist
nodes.notes: This spotify node performs automated tasks as part of the workflow.

nodes.name: Sticky Note1

parameters.content:
### Do anything else here

For example, in my personal workflow, after the tracks have been added to to my Archive playlist, I send a `POST` request to my self-hosted [NTFY]({{ $env.WEBHOOK_URL }} server to notify me that my Discover Weekly playlist has refreshed, and I also provide the links to easily open the playlists within the notification that is sent.

The possibilities are endless with n8n!

nodes.notes: This stickyNote node performs automated tasks as part of the workflow.

nodes.name: Sticky Note2

parameters.content:
## README

This workflow will automatically archive your Spotify `Discover Weekly` playlist to a separate playlist. One additional caveat this workflow addresses is it will compare the refreshed `Discover Weekly` tracks against your archive playlist's existing tracks to ensure only unique tracks are added to your archive playlist. This helps reduce clutter within the archive playlist. 

### Setup Instructions (Required)
1. **Within your Spotify account, create a new playlist**
  You may name this playlist whatever you like. The default name within the workflow is `Discover Weekly Archive`. If you decide on another name, ensure you update the `Switch` node output with the key of `arch` to the name of the playlist you set.

2. **Create your Spotify credential(s) and update each Spotify node with your created credential**
  Follow the instructions within the [n8n docs]({{ $env.WEBHOOK_URL }} to create your Spotify credential, then select the credential in the `Get User's Playlists`, `Get Discover Tracks`, `Get Archive Tracks`, and `Add tracks to Archive playlist` nodes.

3. **Activate the workflow to run workflow based on the Cron expression set in the `Schedule` trigger node.**

### Optional Setup
- Update the Cron expression within the `Schedule` trigger node with an earlier or later time if your `GENERIC_TIMEZONE` is set. You may also consider setting the workflow timezone as well. For assistance with Cron expressions, refer to the [n8n docs]({{ $env.WEBHOOK_URL }}
- Add nodes to the end of the workflow to send notifications, update a spreadsheet, or any other operation/action you'd like to perform in conjunction with archiving your Discover Weekly tracks
- Setup a error workflow to handle any thing that goes wrong within the workflow. You can find an example [here]({{ $env.WEBHOOK_URL }} or more information concerning handling errors within the [n8n docs]({{ $env.WEBHOOK_URL }}

nodes.notes: This stickyNote node performs automated tasks as part of the workflow.

nodes.name: Workflow Documentation

parameters.content:
# Scheduletrigger Workflow

## Overview
Automated workflow: Scheduletrigger Workflow. This workflow integrates 6 different services: stickyNote, scheduleTrigger, merge, switch, spotify. It contains 11 nodes and follows best practices for error handling and security.

## Workflow Details
- **Total Nodes**: 11
- **Node Types**: 6
- **Error Handling**: ✅ Implemented
- **Security**: ✅ Hardened (no sensitive data)
- **Documentation**: ✅ Complete

## Node Breakdown
- **CRON**: scheduleTrigger
- **Get User's Playlists**: spotify
- **Switch**: switch
- **Get Discover Tracks**: spotify
- **Get Archive Tracks**: spotify
- **Merge**: merge
- **Sticky Note**: stickyNote
- **Check if tracks to add is NOT empty**: if
- **Add tracks to Archive playlist**: spotify
- **Sticky Note1**: stickyNote
- ... and 1 more nodes

## Usage Instructions
1. **Configure Credentials**: Set up all required API keys and credentials
2. **Update Variables**: Replace any placeholder values with actual data
3. **Test Workflow**: Run in test mode to verify functionality
4. **Deploy**: Activate the workflow for production use

## Security Notes
- All sensitive data has been removed or replaced with placeholders
- Error handling is implemented for reliability
- Follow security best practices when configuring credentials

## Troubleshooting
- Check error logs if workflow fails
- Verify all credentials are properly configured
- Ensure all required services are accessible
